message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with word spotting in historical documents, which is a task related to computer vision (CV) and information retrieval (IR). The proposed experimental framework involves generating systematic distortions on segmentation, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning (DL) and machine learning (LG) for data augmentation. The paper also evaluates several established and state-of-the-art methods, which is a common practice in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV, followed by cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.LG, and cs.CL.
